meanings.definition: To not believe in the truth or existence of something.
meanings.sent1: She disbelieves the story about the talking animals.
meanings.sent2: I often disbelieve rumors until I see proof.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying pig made her disbelieve her own eyes.
meanings.sent4: His outrageous claim made me disbelieve everything he said.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks were so unbelievable that I had to disbelieve my own senses.

meanings.definition: To reject or refuse to accept something as true.
meanings.sent1: He disbelieves the notion that the Earth is flat.
meanings.sent3: She disbelieves in ghosts but still gets scared during horror movies.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to disbelieve the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to disbelieve the outdated theory to make progress in her research.
